DOC.brief_summary: Decreased cerebral oxygen saturation ( rSO2 ) report occur insufflation laparoscopic procedure due increase Intracranial pressure ( ICP ) resultant decrease cerebral perfusion pressure .
DOC.detailed_description: Forty patient schedule laparoscopic cholecystectomy enrol double blind , randomize control study . Patients receive either 0.5g/kg 20 % intravenous ( i.v . ) mannitol infusion 10 minute immediately induction anesthesia ( group M ) equal volume 0.9 % normal saline instead ( group C ) . Primary outcome measure rSO2 . Secondary outcome variable include extubation time , clinical assessment consciousness recovery use modify Observer 's assessment alertness/sedation scale ( OAA/S ) mini-mental state examination ( MMSE ) cognitive evaluation recovery .
DOC.criteria: American Society Anesthesiologists physical status I II age 25 50 year body mass index ( BMI ) 2234 kg/m2 obstructive restrictive pulmonary disease cardiac dysfunction
